heroIntro: Discover your Mediterranean escape in this stunning 2-bedroom penthouse nestled in the exclusive Lomas de Cabo Roig community on the Costa Blanca. Priced at €440,000, this premium property offers exceptional value—35% less than comparable penthouses in Costa Blanca North—while delivering the sophisticated coastal lifestyle you've always envisioned. With 75m² of beautifully appointed living space, this is the ideal sunshine retreat for discerning buyers seeking a holiday home that combines modern comfort with authentic Mediterranean charm. Whether you're planning weekend getaways, extended summer holidays, or a permanent second home base, this penthouse provides the perfect sanctuary. The property's strategic location puts you minutes from award-winning Blue Flag beaches, championship golf courses, and vibrant beach clubs, while the thriving expat community ensures you'll feel immediately at home. At €5,867/m², you're investing in a premium specification property in one of Spain's most sought-after coastal destinations—a region experiencing consistent 10% year-on-year appreciation.
areaSection: Orihuela Costa sits along one of Spain's most coveted stretches of Mediterranean coastline, approximately 50km south of Alicante airport. This beachfront region combines natural beauty with modern resort-style amenities, featuring over 15 kilometers of pristine sandy beaches backed by pine forests and crystal-clear waters. The climate is exceptional year-round, with over 300 days of sunshine annually and average temperatures reaching 28°C in summer and 15°C in winter—perfect for extended holidays. The area has evolved from a quiet fishing village into a cosmopolitan destination while maintaining its authentic Spanish character. Geographically positioned between the larger towns of Torrevieja and Pilar de la Horadada, Orihuela Costa offers the perfect balance: close enough to urban amenities yet far enough removed for genuine tranquility. The region's popularity with international residents has created exceptional infrastructure, excellent healthcare facilities, and a genuinely multicultural atmosphere where English is widely spoken.
lifestyleSection: Living in Orihuela Costa means waking to Mediterranean sunshine and enjoying beach life as your daily reality. The community is remarkably diverse, with strong British, Scandinavian, Dutch, and German populations creating a welcoming international atmosphere without losing Spanish authenticity. Your typical day might include morning coffee at a beachfront chiringuito, afternoon rounds at world-class golf courses like Villamartín or Las Ramblas, and evening tapas at family-run restaurants specializing in fresh seafood. The weekly markets in nearby Torrevieja and La Zenia offer authentic Spanish produce and local crafts, while modern shopping centers like La Zenia Boulevard provide international brands and convenience. Healthcare standards are exceptionally high, with English-speaking doctors at local clinics and major hospitals just 15-20 minutes away. The expat community organizes regular social events, sports clubs, and cultural activities, making it easy to build friendships. Despite the resort atmosphere, genuine Spanish culture thrives here—you'll discover hidden local favorites away from tourist areas and experience seasonal Spanish traditions alongside modern amenities.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Orihuela Costa exceeds expectations with modern facilities and English-speaking medical professionals. Hospital de Torrevieja, located 15 kilometers away, is one of Spain's finest private hospitals with comprehensive services including emergency, surgery, and specialized treatments. Quirónsalud hospital in nearby Torre del Mar (20km) offers additional capacity and specialties. Multiple local medical centers operate throughout the community with doctors fluent in English, German, and Dutch. Prescription medications are readily available at pharmacies (farmacias) found every 500m. The Spanish healthcare system offers excellent value for expatriates with private insurance, and many residents maintain EU health insurance or affordable private plans.

education.text: International educational options serve families throughout the region. El Limonar International School, 15 kilometers away, provides British curriculum education for ages 3-18 with excellent facilities and strong academic results. Kings College Murcia, located 40 kilometers north, offers an alternative British education option with modern campus facilities. Spanish public schools provide excellent education at minimal cost for families seeking local integration. Orihuela Costa's international community has established robust support networks for families, including tutoring services and extracurricular activities.

shopping.text: Shopping in Orihuela Costa ranges from intimate local markets to major shopping centers. La Zenia Boulevard, 3 kilometers away, houses over 150 shops including international brands, supermarkets, restaurants, and entertainment venues. Daily supermarkets—Mercadona, Consum, Lidl—operate throughout the community with quality products at Spanish prices. Weekly markets in nearby Torrevieja offer fresh produce, local crafts, and authentic Spanish food products. Specialist shops for international goods (British, German, Dutch products) reflect the expatriate community. Online delivery services from major supermarkets now operate in the area for ultimate convenience.

transport.text: While Orihuela Costa is best explored by car, transport connections are excellent. Alicante-Elche International Airport (50km) offers direct flights to major European cities with multiple daily connections. Regional buses connect Orihuela Costa to Torrevieja, Alicante, and surrounding areas, though timetables require planning. The coastal road (N-332) provides direct access to larger towns. Driving throughout the region is straightforward with well-maintained roads and modern roundabouts. Parking is abundant and often free. Many residents find a rental car or personal vehicle essential for maximizing the region's attractions.

The area is famous as a holiday destination combining resort-style amenities with authentic Spanish character, attracting British, Scandinavian, and Northern European residents.
